content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a case involving a dispute over joint ownership of a property the petitioner believes that the registration of the property in the land registry is illegal and should be registered as joint ownership the firstinstance court rejected the petitioners proposal for division of joint ownership the petitioner then filed an appeal claiming factual errors and violations of procedural rules however upon examination the court found no violations of law or factual errors the firstinstance court had correctly determined that the joint ownership had been dissolved based on the registration in the land registry therefore the court confirmed the decision of the firstinstance court as legally valid
